abstract: Pres Hamid Karzai’s government is close to completing a deal that would give Afghan authorities legal oversight of covert nighttime raids, while allowing American forces to retain a guiding role in conducting them; an agreement on the raids would allow Kabul and Washington to move toward completion of a broader pact that lays out the strategic relationship between the two countries after the official end of the NATO combat mission in 2014.

byline.contributor: Elisabeth Bumiller contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The deal would give Afghan authorities legal oversight of nighttime raids on Afghan homes, while allowing American forces to retain a guiding role.

headline.seo: Deal to Continue Afghanistan Night Raids Is Near
headline.main: Deal Close on Night Raids, U.S. and Afghan Officials Say
